bioghist.p: The AIDS Library of Philadelphia serves the community through delivery of information on HIV, such as treatments, nutrition, and history of the pandemic, and referrals to regional and national resources. This information is provided through a variety of media including books, periodicals, medical journals, videos, audio cassettes, CD-ROM, and the Internet. In addition, the AIDS Library regularly hosts events on HIV related issues. The mission of the AIDS Library is to improve access to health and support services, prevent HIV transmission, and raise the public awareness of HIV/AIDS related issues.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records and reference materials of the AIDS Library/AIDS Information Network. Office records include: correspondence and memos; financial information; board minutes; budget, fundraising, and development records; office policies and guidelines; volunteer records; and some personnel files. Reference materials include: newspaper clippings; magazines containing stories about HIV/AIDS; newsletters from a variety of health and activist organizations, including AIDS Treatment News, We The People, and AIDS Insurance News; programs and other materials from international and national AIDS conferences; treatment, research, and resource guides for people with HIV/AIDS; brochures, pamphlets, and flyers from a number of AIDS organizations; audiovisual resources on AIDS treatment, caregiving, and research, including audiocassettes, vinyl LPs, CDs and DVDs; and artifacts, including buttons, t-shirts, and condoms. The collection contains records of Jenny Pierce, Jean Hofacket, and Dominick D'Ortenzio.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
